snippet: On Sunday, President Obama will address the nation on the broad threat of terrorism, while providing updates on the investigation into the attack in San Bernardino, Calif.
abstract: Mass shooting in San Bernardino, Calif, was preceded by no concrete warning, prompting officials to reconsider antiterrorism approach; attack represents long-dreaded evolution of terrorism to attacks carried out by homegrown, self-radicalized individuals in United States; new approach may rely more on outreach and community involvement.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Michael S. Schmidt, Scott Shane, Matt Apuzzo, Mark Mazzetti and Gardiner Harris from Washington.

lead_paragraph: On Sunday, President Obama will address the nation on the broad threat of terrorism, while providing updates on the investigation into the attack in San Bernardino, Calif.

headline.main: California Attack Has U.S. Rethinking Strategy on Homegrown Terror
headline.print_headline: Rampage Has U.S. Rethinking How to Stop Attacks

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
